text:
To display your moths for everyone to see them, you will either pin them or glue them.

If you have very small moths, you will be better off gluing them. Larger moths are easier to pin.

To pin your moths, watch this Moth Pinning video .

If you are going to glue your moths, watch the Moth Gluing video.
Once your students have sorted and pinned their moths, they may want to document each one by taking photos and creating individual data cards for further analysis.

Photographing moths for use in CLUE

Set up a station for photographing pinned moths one-by-one in order to include a photo of each moth on its data card. You will need a tripod set up for your phone or digital camera. These are what we used:

Compact Digital Camera for Kids

Adjustable Phone Tripod

This will probably be an after-school task for you to then upload to Google or wherever your students can access. Here is an example of a page of moths for a Michigan classroom: Andy ªs moths in Google photos.
